summary: This is a court order by Judge Alison J. Nathan granting a short continuance of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial from July 2021 to fall 2021. The continuance is granted due to the government's late filing of an S2 Superseding Indictment, which added new charges and an alleged victim, requiring additional defense preparation time. The order balances the defense's need to prepare against the public interest in a timely trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense counsel requested a continuance of the trial date due to a new superseding indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge presiding over the case, who authored this order granting a trial continuance.

persons.name: Judge Furman
persons.context: A judge presiding over a separate criminal matter involving lawyers who are also involved in the Maxwell case, mentioned in the context of a scheduling conflict.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Filing of S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: The Government filed an S2 Superseding Indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding new charges and extending the timeframe of alleged conspiracies.

events.title: Original Trial Start Date
events.description: The trial in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was originally scheduled to commence on this date.

events.title: Court Order Granting Continuance
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order granting a continuance of Maxwell's trial date from July 2021 to fall 2021.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Trial Date Proposal
events.description: The parties are ordered to meet and confer and jointly propose a new trial start date to the court by this date.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: The S2 Superseding Indictment extended the timeframe of the alleged conspiracies from 1997 to 2004 and identified a fourth alleged victim, referred to as Minor Victim-4.
The S2 Indictment added two new charges: Count 5 (sex trafficking conspiracy 2001-2004) and Count 6 (sex trafficking of a minor or aiding and abetting).
The court granted a continuance to fall 2021, rejecting both Maxwell's request for a January 2022 date and the Government's proposal for March 2022.
The court cited the COVID-19 pandemic as a factor hampering trial preparation due to travel constraints and safety concerns.
The order emphasizes the need to balance the defense's preparation time against the public and victims' interest in a trial without undue delay.
